00067 const char* default_name( bool free_only )
00068 {
00069   static const char all_name[] = "QualityAssessor";
00070   static const char free_name[] = "QualityAssessor(free only)";
00071   return free_only ? free_name : all_name;
00072 }

00074 QualityAssessor::QualityAssessor( bool print_summary,
00075                                   bool free_only,
00076                                   const char* inverted_tag_name,
00077                                   std::string name) :
00078   myData(new Data),
00079   qualityAssessorName(name),
00080   outputStream( std::cout ),
00081   printSummary( print_summary ),
00082   skipFixedSamples(free_only)
00083 {
00084   if (inverted_tag_name)
00085     tag_inverted_elements( inverted_tag_name );
00086     
00087   if (qualityAssessorName.empty()) 
00088     qualityAssessorName = default_name( free_only );
00089 
00090   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00091     elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = 0;
00092 }

00166 QualityAssessor::QualityAssessor( const QualityAssessor& copy ) :
00167   myData(copy.myData),
00168   qualityAssessorName(copy.qualityAssessorName),
00169   assessList(copy.assessList),
00170   outputStream(copy.outputStream),
00171   printSummary(copy.printSummary),
00172   invertedTagName(copy.invertedTagName),
00173   fixedTagName(copy.fixedTagName),
00174   skipFixedSamples(copy.skipFixedSamples)
00175 
00176 {
00177   list_type::iterator iter;
00178   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) 
00179     (*iter)->referenceCount++;
00180   myData->referenceCount++;
00181 
00182  for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00183    elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = copy.elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON];
00184 }
00185 
00186 QualityAssessor& QualityAssessor::operator=( const QualityAssessor& copy )
00187 {
00188   list_type::iterator iter;
00189   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00190     Assessor* assessor = *iter;
00191     if (0 == --assessor->referenceCount)
00192       delete assessor;
00193   }
00194 
00195   myData = copy.myData;
00196   qualityAssessorName = copy.qualityAssessorName;
00197   assessList = copy.assessList;
00198   printSummary = copy.printSummary;
00199   invertedTagName = copy.invertedTagName;
00200   fixedTagName = copy.fixedTagName;
00201   skipFixedSamples = copy.skipFixedSamples;
00202   
00203   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) 
00204     (*iter)->referenceCount++;
00205   myData->referenceCount++;
00206 
00207   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00208     elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = copy.elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON];
00209     
00210   return *this;
00211 }  
00212 
00213 QualityAssessor::~QualityAssessor()
00214 {
00215   list_type::iterator iter;
00216   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00217     Assessor* assessor = *iter;
00218     if (0 == --assessor->referenceCount)
00219       delete assessor;
00220   }
00221   if (0 == --myData->referenceCount)
00222     delete myData;
00223 }
00224  
00225 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_average() const
00226 {
00227   return count ? sum/count : 0;
00228 }
00229 
00230 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_rms() const 
00231 {
00232   return count ? sqrt(sqrSum/count) : 0;
00233 }
00234 
00235 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_stddev() const
00236 {
00237   double sqr = count ? sqrSum/count - sum*sum/((double)count*count) : 0;
00238   return sqr < 0 ? 0 : sqrt(sqr);
00239 }
00240 
00241 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::get_power_mean() const
00242 {
00243   return (count && pMean) ? pow(pSum/count, 1/pMean) : 0;
00244 }
00245 
00246 bool QualityAssessor::get_inverted_element_count(int &inverted_elems,
00247                                                  int &inverted_samples,
00248                                                  MsqError &err)
00249 {
00250   if(myData->invertedElementCount == -1){
00251     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Number of inverted elements has not yet been calculated.", MsqError::INVALID_STATE);
00252     return false;
00253   }
00254   inverted_elems = myData->invertedElementCount;
00255   inverted_samples = myData->invertedSampleCount;
00256   return true;
00257 }

00260 
00261 void QualityAssessor::add_quality_assessment( QualityMetric* metric,
00262                                               int histogram_intervals,
00263                                               double power_mean,
00264                                               const char* tag_name,
00265                                               const char* label )
00266 { 
00267   list_type::iterator i = find_or_add( metric, label );
00268   (*i)->pMean = power_mean;
00269   if (histogram_intervals > 0)
00270     (*i)->histogram.resize( histogram_intervals+2 );
00271   else
00272     (*i)->histogram.clear();
00273   (*i)->haveHistRange = false;
00274   if (!tag_name)
00275     (*i)->tagName.clear();
00276   else
00277     (*i)->tagName = tag_name;
00278 }
00279 
00280 QualityAssessor::list_type::iterator QualityAssessor::find_or_add( 
00281                                                 QualityMetric* qm,
00282                                                 const char* label )
00283 {
00284   list_type::iterator iter;
00285   
00286     // If metric is already in list, find it
00287   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00288     if ((*iter)->qualMetric == qm )
00289       break;
00290   
00291     // If metric not found in list, add it
00292   if (iter == assessList.end())
00293   {
00294     Assessor* new_assessor = new Assessor(qm, label);
00295     new_assessor->referenceCount = 1;
00296     if (qm->get_metric_type() == QualityMetric::VERTEX_BASED)
00297     {
00298       assessList.push_back( new_assessor );
00299       iter = --assessList.end();
00300     }
00301     else
00302     {
00303       assessList.push_front( new_assessor );
00304       iter = assessList.begin();
00305     }
00306   }
00307   
00308   return iter;
00309 }
00310 
00311 QualityAssessor::list_type::iterator QualityAssessor::find_stopping_assessment()
00312 {
00313   list_type::iterator iter;
00314   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00315     if ((*iter)->stopping_function())
00316       break;
00317   return iter;
00318 }
00319 
00320 
00330 void QualityAssessor::set_stopping_assessment( QualityMetric* metric,
00331                                                int histogram_intervals,
00332                                                double power_mean,
00333                                                const char* tag_name,
00334                                                const char* label )
00335 {
00336   list_type::iterator i = find_stopping_assessment();
00337   if (i != assessList.end())
00338     (*i)->set_stopping_function(false);
00339 
00340   i = find_or_add( metric, label );
00341   (*i)->pMean = power_mean;
00342   if (histogram_intervals > 0)
00343     (*i)->histogram.resize( histogram_intervals+2 );
00344   else
00345     (*i)->histogram.clear();
00346   (*i)->haveHistRange = false;
00347   if (!tag_name)
00348     (*i)->tagName.clear();
00349   else
00350     (*i)->tagName = tag_name;
00351   (*i)->set_stopping_function(true);
00352 }
00353 
00354 
00365 void QualityAssessor::add_histogram_assessment( QualityMetric* metric,
00366                                                 double min_val, 
00367                                                 double max_val,
00368                                                 int intervals,
00369                                                 double power_mean,
00370                                                 const char* tag_name,
00371                                                 const char* label )
00372 {
00373   if (intervals < 1)
00374     intervals = 1;
00375   list_type::iterator i = find_or_add( metric, label );
00376   (*i)->pMean = power_mean;
00377   (*i)->histMin = min_val;
00378   (*i)->histMax = max_val;
00379   (*i)->haveHistRange = min_val < max_val;
00380   (*i)->histogram.resize( intervals + 2 );
00381   if (!tag_name)
00382     (*i)->tagName.clear();
00383   else
00384     (*i)->tagName = tag_name;
00385 }

00387 
00388 TagHandle QualityAssessor::get_tag( Mesh* mesh,
00389                                     std::string name, 
00390                                     Mesh::TagType type, 
00391                                     unsigned size, 
00392                                     MsqError& err )
00393 {
00394   TagHandle tag  = mesh->tag_get( name, err );
00395   if (!err) {
00396     Mesh::TagType exist_type;
00397     std::string junk;
00398     unsigned exist_size;
00399     mesh->tag_properties( tag, junk, exist_type, exist_size, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00400     if (type != exist_type || size != exist_size) {
00401        MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError:: TAG_ALREADY_EXISTS,
00402        "Tag \"%s\" exists with incorrect type or length.",
00403        name.c_str());
00404     }
00405   }
00406   else if (err.error_code() == MsqError::TAG_NOT_FOUND) {
00407     err.clear();
00408     tag = mesh->tag_create( name, type, size, 0, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00409   }
00410   else {
00411     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00412   }
00413   
00414   return tag;
00415 }

00417 void QualityAssessor::initialize_queue( Mesh* mesh,
00418                                         MeshDomain* domain,
00419                                         const Settings* settings,
00420                                         MsqError& err )
00421 {
00422   for (list_type::iterator i = assessList.begin(); i != assessList.end(); ++i) {
00423     (*i)->get_metric()->initialize_queue( mesh, domain, settings, err );
00424     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00425   }
00426 }

00442                                         MsqError& err)

00458 double QualityAssessor::loop_over_mesh( ParallelMesh* mesh,
00459                                         MeshDomain* domain,
00460                                         const Settings* settings,
00461                                         MsqError& err)
00462 {
00463   return loop_over_mesh_internal( mesh, domain, settings,

00466 
00467 double QualityAssessor::loop_over_mesh_internal( Mesh* mesh,
00468                                                  MeshDomain* domain,
00469                                                  const Settings* settings,
00470                                                  ParallelHelper* helper,
00471                                                  MsqError& err )
00472 {
00473     // Clear out any previous data
00474   reset_data();
00475 
00476     // Clear culling flag, set hard fixed flag, etc on all vertices
00477   initialize_vertex_byte( mesh, domain, settings, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00478 
00479   PatchData patch;
00480   patch.set_mesh( mesh );
00481   patch.set_domain( domain );
00482   if (settings)
00483     patch.attach_settings( settings );
00484   
00485   ElementPatches elem_patches;
00486   elem_patches.set_mesh( mesh );
00487   VertexPatches vert_patches(1,false);
00488   vert_patches.set_mesh( mesh );
00489   
00490   std::vector<PatchSet::PatchHandle> patches;
00491   std::vector<PatchSet::PatchHandle>::iterator p;
00492   std::vector<Mesh::VertexHandle> patch_verts;
00493   std::vector<Mesh::ElementHandle> patch_elems;
00494   std::vector<size_t> metric_handles;
00495 
00496     // Check if we really need the helper
00497   if (helper && helper->get_nprocs() == 1) helper = 0;
00498 
00499     // Get any necessary tag handles.
00500   TagHandle invertedTag = 0;
00501   if (tagging_inverted_elements()) {
00502     invertedTag = get_tag( mesh, invertedTagName, Mesh::INT, 1, err );
00503     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00504   }
00505   list_type::iterator iter;
00506   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00507     if ((*iter)->write_to_tag()) {
00508       (*iter)->tagHandle = get_tag( mesh, (*iter)->tagName, Mesh::DOUBLE, 1, err );
00509       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00510     }
00511   }
00512   
00513   TagHandle fixedTag = 0;
00514   if (tagging_fixed_elements()) {
00515     fixedTag = get_tag( mesh, fixedTagName, Mesh::INT, 1, err );
00516     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00517   }
00518   
00519     // Check for any metrics for which a histogram is to be 
00520     // calculated and for which the user has not specified 
00521     // minimum and maximum values.  
00522     // Element-based metrics are first in list, followed
00523     // by vertex-based metrics.  Find first vertex-based
00524     // metric also such that element metrics go from
00525     // assessList.begin() to elem_end and vertex metrics
00526     // go from elem_end to assessList.end()
00527   list_type::iterator elem_end = assessList.end();
00528   bool need_second_pass_for_elements = false;
00529   bool need_second_pass_for_vertices = false;
00530   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00531   {
00532     if ((*iter)->get_metric()->get_metric_type() == QualityMetric::VERTEX_BASED)
00533       break;
00534 
00535     if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00536       need_second_pass_for_elements = true;
00537   }
00538   elem_end = iter;
00539   for ( ; iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00540   {
00541     if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00542       need_second_pass_for_vertices = true;
00543   }
00544   
00545     // Do element-based metrics
00546   elem_patches.get_patch_handles( patches, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00547 
00548   myData->invertedElementCount = myData->invertedSampleCount = myData->sampleCount = 0;
00549   myData->elementCount = patches.size();
00550   myData->freeElementCount = 0;
00551   
00552   int inverted, samples;
00553   bool first_pass = false;
00554   do { // might need to loop twice to calculate histograms
00555     first_pass = !first_pass;
00556 
00557       //until there are no more patches
00558       //there is another get_next_patch at
00559       //the end of this loop
00560     for (p = patches.begin(); p != patches.end(); ++p) {
00561       elem_patches.get_patch( *p, patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00562 
00563       if (helper) {
00564         bool ours = helper->is_our_element( patch_elems[0], err );
00565         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00566         if (!ours) {
00567           --myData->elementCount;
00568           continue;
00569         }
00570       }
00571       patch.set_mesh_entities( patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00572       
00573       if (first_pass)
00574       {
00575           // record element type for use in print_summary
00576         for (size_t i=0; i < patch.num_elements(); i++)
00577         {
00578           const MsqMeshEntity* elem = &patch.element_by_index(i);
00579           EntityTopology topo = elem->get_element_type();  
00580           elementTypeCount[topo - POLYGON]++;
00581         }
00582       }
00583 
00584       if (0 == patch.num_free_vertices()) {
00585         if (tagging_fixed_elements()) {
00586           Mesh::ElementHandle h = patch.get_element_handles_array()[0];
00587           int val = 1;
00588           mesh->tag_set_element_data( fixedTag, 1, &h, &val, err );
00589           MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00590         }
00591         if (skipFixedSamples)
00592           continue;
00593       }
00594       
00595        //first check for inverted elements
00596       if (first_pass){
00597         ++myData->freeElementCount;
00598         inverted = samples = 0;
00599         patch.element_by_index(0).check_element_orientation(patch, inverted, samples, err);
00600         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00601         myData->invertedElementCount += (inverted != 0);
00602         myData->invertedSampleCount += inverted;
00603         myData->sampleCount += samples;
00604 
00605         if (tagging_inverted_elements()) {
00606           Mesh::ElementHandle h = patch.get_element_handles_array()[0];
00607           int val = (inverted != 0);
00608           mesh->tag_set_element_data( invertedTag, 1, &h, &val, err );
00609           MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00610         }
00611       }
00612 
00613       // now process all element-based metrics
00614       for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != elem_end; ++iter)
00615       {
00616           // If first pass, get values for all metrics
00617         if (first_pass)
00618         {
00619           double value = 0.0;
00620           metric_handles.clear();
00621           QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00622           qm->get_single_pass( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00623           for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00624                j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00625           {
00626             bool valid = (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00627             (*iter)->add_value(value);
00628             if (!valid) 
00629               (*iter)->add_invalid_value();
00630           }
00631             // we don't do tag stuff unless metric is truely element-based
00632             // (only one value per element)
00633           if ((*iter)->write_to_tag() && metric_handles.size() == 1) {
00634             Mesh::ElementHandle h = patch.get_element_handles_array()[0];
00635             mesh->tag_set_element_data( (*iter)->tagHandle, 1, &h, &value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00636           }
00637         }
00638           // If second pass, only do metrics for which the
00639           // histogram hasn't been calculated yet.
00640         else if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00641         {
00642           metric_handles.clear();
00643           QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00644           qm->get_evaluations( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00645           for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00646                j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00647           {
00648             double value;
00649             (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00650             (*iter)->add_hist_value(value);
00651           }
00652         }
00653       }
00654     }
00655     if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return 0.0;
00656 
00657       // Fix up any histogram ranges which were calculated
00658     for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != elem_end; ++iter)
00659       if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00660         if (first_pass) {
00661           if (helper) {
00662             helper->communicate_min_max_to_all(&((*iter)->minimum), &((*iter)->maximum), err); 
00663             MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00664           }
00665         
00666           (*iter)->calculate_histogram_range();
00667 // Uncomment the following to have the QA keep the first
00668 // calculated histogram range for all subsequent iterations.
00669 //          else
00670 //            (*iter)->haveHistRange = true;
00671         }
00672   } while (first_pass && need_second_pass_for_elements);
00673       
00674     
00675       // Do vertex-based metrics
00676   if (assessList.end() != elem_end)
00677   {
00678     vert_patches.get_patch_handles( patches, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00679     
00680     bool first_pass = false;
00681     do { // might need to loop twice to calculate histograms
00682       first_pass = !first_pass;
00683      
00684         //until there are no more patches
00685         //there is another get_next_patch at
00686         //the end of this loop
00687       for (p = patches.begin(); p != patches.end(); ++p) {
00688         vert_patches.get_patch( *p, patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00689         patch.set_mesh_entities( patch_elems, patch_verts, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00690         if (skipFixedSamples && 0 == patch.num_free_vertices())
00691           continue;
00692         
00693         Mesh::VertexHandle vert_handle = reinterpret_cast<Mesh::VertexHandle>(*p);
00694 
00695         for (iter = elem_end; iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00696         {
00697             // If first pass, get values for all metrics
00698           if (first_pass)
00699           {
00700             double value = 0.0;
00701             metric_handles.clear();
00702             QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00703             qm->get_single_pass( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00704             for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00705                  j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00706             {
00707               bool valid = (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00708               (*iter)->add_value(value);
00709               if (!valid) 
00710                 (*iter)->add_invalid_value();
00711             }
00712               // we don't do tag stuff unless metric is truely vertex-based
00713               // (only one value per vertex)
00714             if ((*iter)->write_to_tag() && metric_handles.size() == 1) {
00715               mesh->tag_set_vertex_data( (*iter)->tagHandle, 1, &vert_handle, &value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00716             }
00717           }
00718             // If second pass, only do metrics for which the
00719             // histogram hasn't been calculated yet.
00720           else if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00721           {
00722             metric_handles.clear();
00723             QualityMetric* qm = (*iter)->get_metric();
00724             qm->get_evaluations( patch, metric_handles, skipFixedSamples, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00725             for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator j = metric_handles.begin(); 
00726                  j != metric_handles.end(); ++j) 
00727             {
00728               double value;
00729               (*iter)->get_metric()->evaluate( patch, *j, value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00730               (*iter)->add_hist_value(value);
00731             }
00732           }
00733         }
00734       }
00735       if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return 0.0;
00736   
00737         // Fix up any histogram ranges which were calculated
00738       for (iter = elem_end; iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00739         if ((*iter)->have_histogram() && !(*iter)->haveHistRange)
00740           if (first_pass) {
00741             if (helper) {
00742               helper->communicate_min_max_to_all(&((*iter)->minimum), &((*iter)->maximum), err); 
00743               MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00744             }
00745             (*iter)->calculate_histogram_range();
00746 // Uncomment the following to have the QA keep the first
00747 // calculated histogram range for all subsequent iterations.
00748 //          else
00749 //            (*iter)->haveHistRange = true;
00750           }
00751     } while (first_pass && need_second_pass_for_vertices);
00752   }  
00753   
00754   if (helper) {
00755     for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
00756 
00757       helper->communicate_min_max_to_zero(&((*iter)->minimum), &((*iter)->maximum), err);
00758       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00759 
00760       helper->communicate_sums_to_zero(&myData->freeElementCount, &myData->invertedElementCount, &myData->elementCount, &myData->invertedSampleCount, &myData->sampleCount, &((*iter)->count), &((*iter)->numInvalid), &((*iter)->sum), &((*iter)->sqrSum), err);
00761       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00762 
00763       if ((*iter)->have_power_mean()) {
00764         helper->communicate_power_sum_to_zero( &((*iter)->pMean), err );
00765         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00766       }
00767 
00768       if ((*iter)->have_histogram()) {
00769         helper->communicate_histogram_to_zero((*iter)->histogram, err);
00770         MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00771       }
00772     }
00773   }
00774   
00775     // Print results, if requested
00776   if (printSummary && (!helper || helper->get_rank() == 0))
00777     print_summary( this->outputStream );
00778   
00779   list_type::iterator i = find_stopping_assessment();
00780   return i == assessList.end() ? 0 : (*i)->stopping_function_value();
00781 }
00782 
00783 bool QualityAssessor::invalid_elements( ) const
00784 {
00785   bool result = false;
00786   list_type::const_iterator iter;
00787   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00788     if ((*iter)->get_invalid_element_count())
00789       result = true;
00790   return result;
00791 }
00792 
00793 void QualityAssessor::reset_data() 
00794 {
00795   list_type::iterator iter;
00796   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00797     (*iter)->reset_data();
00798   myData->invertedElementCount = -1;
00799   myData->invertedSampleCount = -1;
00800 
00801   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
00802     elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] = 0;
00803 }
00804 
00805 void QualityAssessor::scale_histograms(QualityAssessor* optimized)
00806 {
00807     // find the histograms to scale
00808   list_type::iterator iter;
00809   list_type::iterator initial;
00810   list_type::iterator optimal;
00811   bool initial_found = false, optimal_found = false;
00812   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
00813   {
00814     if ((*iter)->histogram.size() > 0)
00815     {
00816       if (initial_found == false)
00817       {
00818         initial = iter;
00819         initial_found = true;
00820         break;
00821       }
00822     }
00823   }
00824   for (iter = optimized->assessList.begin(); iter != optimized->assessList.end(); ++iter)
00825   {
00826     if ((*iter)->histogram.size() > 0)
00827     {
00828       optimal = iter;
00829       optimal_found = true;
00830       break;
00831     }
00832   }
00833   if (!initial_found || !optimal_found)
00834   {
00835       // issue warning: orig histograms not found
00836     if (!initial_found)
00837       outputStream << "WARNING: 'before' histogram not found" << std::endl;
00838     else
00839       outputStream << "WARNING: 'after' histogram not found" << std::endl;
00840     return;
00841   }
00842 
00843     // check number of intervals (bins) for each histogram
00844   int num_intervals = (*initial)->histogram.size()-2;
00845   if (num_intervals != int((*optimal)->histogram.size()-2))
00846   {
00847        // issue warning: number of intervals not the same   
00848     outputStream << "WARNING: histogram intervals are not the same" << std::endl;
00849     return;
00850   }
00851 
00852     // calculate new max and min values
00853   double combined_min, combined_max;  
00854   if ((*initial)->histMin < (*optimal)->histMin)
00855     combined_min = (*initial)->histMin;
00856   else
00857     combined_min = (*optimal)->histMin;
00858 
00859   if ((*initial)->histMax > (*optimal)->histMax)
00860     combined_max = (*initial)->histMax;
00861   else
00862     combined_max = (*optimal)->histMax;
00863 
00864     // put the before quality values into the correct new bins
00865 
00866     // First and last values in array are counts of valuesnum_intervals+1
00867     // outside the user-specified range of the histogram
00868     // (below and above, respectively.)
00869   std::vector<int> new_initial_histogram;    
00870   new_initial_histogram.resize((*initial)->histogram.size(), 0);
00871   new_initial_histogram[0] = (*initial)->histogram[0];
00872   new_initial_histogram[new_initial_histogram.size()-1] = 
00873                   (*initial)->histogram[(*initial)->histogram.size()-1];
00874   
00875     // Re-calculate which interval the value is in.  Add one
00876     // because first entry is for values below user-specifed
00877     // minimum value for histogram.
00878   double combined_range = combined_max - combined_min;
00879   double initial_min = (*initial)->histMin;
00880   double optimal_min = (*optimal)->histMin;
00881   double initial_range = (*initial)->histMax - (*initial)->histMin;
00882   double optimal_range = (*optimal)->histMax - (*optimal)->histMin;
00883   double combined_step = combined_range / num_intervals;
00884   double initial_step = initial_range / num_intervals;
00885   double optimal_step = optimal_range / num_intervals;
00886     // round steps to 3 significant digits
00887   if (combined_step >= 0.001)
00888     combined_step = round_to_3_significant_digits(combined_step);
00889   if (initial_step >= 0.001)
00890     initial_step = round_to_3_significant_digits(initial_step);
00891   if (optimal_step >= 0.001)
00892     optimal_step = round_to_3_significant_digits(optimal_step);
00893 
00894     // populate initial histogram
00895   if (initial_range == combined_range)
00896   {
00897       // just copy histogram
00898     new_initial_histogram = (*initial)->histogram;
00899   }
00900   else
00901   {
00902     for (size_t i=1 ; i < new_initial_histogram.size()-1; i++)
00903     {
00904       double combined_bin_value = combined_min + (combined_step * (i-1));
00905       for (size_t j=1; j < new_initial_histogram.size()-1; j++)
00906       {
00907         double initial_bin_value = initial_min + (initial_step * (j-1));
00908         if ( initial_bin_value >= combined_bin_value &&
00909              initial_bin_value < combined_bin_value + combined_step)
00910         {
00911           new_initial_histogram[i] += (*initial)->histogram[j];
00912         }
00913       }
00914     }
00915   }
00916 
00917     // put the optimal quality values into the correct new bins
00918   std::vector<int> new_optimal_histogram; 
00919   new_optimal_histogram.resize((*optimal)->histogram.size(), 0);
00920   new_optimal_histogram[0] = (*optimal)->histogram[0];
00921   new_optimal_histogram[new_optimal_histogram.size()-1] = 
00922                 (*optimal)->histogram[(*optimal)->histogram.size()-1];
00923 
00924     // populate optimal histogram
00925   if (optimal_range == combined_range)
00926   {
00927       // just copy histogram
00928     new_optimal_histogram = (*optimal)->histogram;
00929   }
00930   else
00931   {
00932     for (size_t i=1 ; i < new_optimal_histogram.size()-1; i++)
00933     {
00934       double combined_bin_value = combined_min + (combined_step * (i-1));
00935       for (size_t j=1; j < new_optimal_histogram.size()-1; j++)
00936       {
00937         double optimal_bin_value = optimal_min + (optimal_step * (j-1));
00938         if (optimal_bin_value >= combined_bin_value &&
00939             optimal_bin_value < combined_bin_value + combined_step)
00940         {
00941           new_optimal_histogram[i] += (*optimal)->histogram[j];
00942         }
00943       }
00944     }
00945   }
00946 
00947     // determine largest number of values in a 'bin' for both histograms
00948   unsigned i;
00949   int max_interval_num = 1;
00950   for (i = 0; i < new_initial_histogram.size(); ++i)
00951   {
00952     if (new_initial_histogram[i] > max_interval_num)
00953       max_interval_num = new_initial_histogram[i];
00954   }
00955   for (i = 0; i < new_optimal_histogram.size(); ++i)
00956   {
00957     if (new_optimal_histogram[i] > max_interval_num)
00958       max_interval_num = new_optimal_histogram[i];
00959   }
00960 
00961     // calculate how many bar graph characters will represent the 
00962     // largest 'bin' value.
00963     // create the 'before' histogram
00964   int termwidth = get_terminal_width();
00965   const char indent[] = "   ";
00966   const char GRAPH_CHAR = '=';  // Character used to create bar graphs
00967   const int TOTAL_WIDTH = termwidth > 30 ? termwidth : 70;   // Width of histogram
00968   int GRAPHW = TOTAL_WIDTH - sizeof(indent);
00969 
00970   if (0 == max_interval_num)
00971     return; // no data 
00972   
00973     // Calculate width of field containing counts for 
00974     // histogram intervals (log10(max_interval)).
00975   int num_width = 1;
00976   for (int temp = max_interval_num; temp > 0; temp /= 10)
00977     ++num_width;
00978   GRAPHW -= num_width;
00979 
00980      // Create an array of bar graph characters for use in output
00981   std::vector<char> graph_chars(GRAPHW+1, GRAPH_CHAR);
00982   
00983     // Check if bar-graph should be linear or log10 plot
00984     // Do log plot if standard deviation is less that 1.5
00985     // histogram intervals.
00986 
00987   bool log_plot = false;
00988   double stddev = (*initial)->get_stddev();
00989   if (stddev > 0 && stddev < 2.0*combined_step)
00990   {
00991     int new_interval = (int)(log10((double)(1+max_interval_num)));
00992     if (new_interval > 0) {
00993       log_plot = true;
00994       max_interval_num = new_interval;
00995     }
00996   }
00997     // output the 'before' histogram
00998 
00999     // Write title
01000    outputStream << std::endl 
01001                 << "************** Common-scale Histograms **************" 
01002                 << std::endl << std::endl;
01003    outputStream << indent << (*initial)->get_label() << " histogram (initial mesh):";
01004   if (log_plot)
01005     outputStream << " (log10 plot)";
01006   outputStream << std::endl;
01007 
01008     // Calculate width of a single quality interval value
01009   double interval_value = 0.0;
01010   int max_interval_width = 0;
01011   std::stringstream str_stream;
01012   std::string interval_string; 
01013   for (i = 0; i < new_initial_histogram.size(); ++i)
01014   {
01015     interval_value = combined_min + (i)*combined_step;
01016     if (combined_step >= .001)
01017       interval_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(interval_value);
01018     str_stream.clear();
01019     str_stream.str(""); 
01020     interval_string = "";
01021     str_stream << interval_value;
01022     interval_string = str_stream.str();
01023     if (interval_string.length() >  (size_t)max_interval_width)
01024       max_interval_width = interval_string.length();
01025   }
01026 
01027     // adjust graph width for actual size of interval values
01028   GRAPHW = GRAPHW - (max_interval_width*2) - 5; 
01029 
01030     // For each interval of histogram
01031   for (i = 0; i < new_initial_histogram.size(); ++i)
01032   {
01033       // First value is the count of the number of values that
01034       // were below the minimum value of the histogram.
01035     if (0 == i)
01036     {
01037       if (0 == new_initial_histogram[i])
01038         continue;
01039       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "under min";
01040     }
01041       // Last value is the count of the number of values that
01042       // were above the maximum value of the histogram.
01043     else if (i+1 == new_initial_histogram.size())
01044     {
01045       if (0 == new_initial_histogram[i])
01046         continue;
01047       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "over max";
01048     }
01049       // Anything else is a valid interval of the histogram.
01050       // Print the range for each interval.
01051     else
01052     {
01053       double start_value = combined_min + (i-1)*combined_step;
01054       double end_value = combined_min + (i)*combined_step;
01055 
01056       if (combined_step >= 0.001)
01057       {
01058         start_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(start_value);
01059         end_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(end_value);
01060       }
01061 
01062       outputStream << indent << "(" << std::setw(max_interval_width) << std::right 
01063                    << start_value << "-" << std::setw(max_interval_width) 
01064                    << std::left << end_value << ") |";
01065     }
01066 
01067       // Print bar graph
01068     
01069       // First calculate the number of characters to output
01070     int num_graph;
01071     if (log_plot)
01072       num_graph = GRAPHW * (int)log10((double)(1+new_initial_histogram[i])) / max_interval_num;
01073     else
01074       num_graph = GRAPHW * new_initial_histogram[i] / max_interval_num;
01075       
01076       // print num_graph characters using array of fill characters.
01077     graph_chars[num_graph] = '\0';
01078     outputStream << arrptr(graph_chars);
01079     graph_chars[num_graph] = GRAPH_CHAR;
01080 
01081       // Print interval count.
01082     outputStream << new_initial_histogram[i] << std::endl;
01083   }
01084   
01085    outputStream << "  metric was evaluated " << (*initial)->count << " times." 
01086                 << std::endl << std::endl;
01087 
01088     // output the 'after' histogram
01089    outputStream << std::endl << indent << (*optimal)->get_label() << " histogram (optimal mesh):";
01090   if (log_plot)
01091     outputStream << " (log10 plot)";
01092   outputStream << std::endl;
01093 
01094     // For each interval of histogram
01095   for (i = 0; i < new_optimal_histogram.size(); ++i)
01096   {
01097       // First value is the count of the number of values that
01098       // were below the minimum value of the histogram.
01099     if (0 == i)
01100     {
01101       if (0 == new_optimal_histogram[i])
01102         continue;
01103       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "under min";
01104     }
01105       // Last value is the count of the number of values that
01106       // were above the maximum value of the histogram.
01107     else if (i+1 == new_optimal_histogram.size())
01108     {
01109       if (0 == new_optimal_histogram[i])
01110         continue;
01111       outputStream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "over max";
01112     }
01113       // Anything else is a valid interval of the histogram.
01114       // Print the range for each interval.
01115     else
01116     {
01117       double start_value = combined_min + (i-1)*combined_step;
01118       double end_value = combined_min + (i)*combined_step;
01119 
01120       if (combined_step >= 0.001)
01121       {
01122         start_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(start_value);
01123         end_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(end_value);
01124       }
01125 
01126       outputStream << indent << "(" << std::setw(max_interval_width) << std::right 
01127                    << start_value << "-" << std::setw(max_interval_width) 
01128                    << std::left << end_value << ") |";
01129 
01130     }
01131 
01132       // Print bar graph
01133     
01134       // First calculate the number of characters to output
01135     int num_graph;
01136     if (log_plot)
01137       num_graph = GRAPHW * (int)log10((double)(1+new_optimal_histogram[i])) / max_interval_num;
01138     else
01139       num_graph = GRAPHW * new_optimal_histogram[i] / max_interval_num;
01140       
01141       // print num_graph characters using array of fill characters.
01142     graph_chars[num_graph] = '\0';
01143     outputStream << arrptr(graph_chars);
01144     graph_chars[num_graph] = GRAPH_CHAR;
01145 
01146       // Print interval count.
01147     outputStream << new_optimal_histogram[i] << std::endl;
01148     
01149   }
01150   
01151    outputStream << "  metric was evaluated " << (*optimal)->count << " times." 
01152                 << std::endl << std::endl;
01153 
01154 
01155   return;
01156 }
01157 
01158 QualityAssessor::Assessor::Assessor( QualityMetric* metric, const char* label )
01159   : qualMetric(metric),
01160     mLabel( label ? std::string(label) : metric->get_name() ),
01161     pMean(0.0),
01162     haveHistRange(false),
01163     histMin(1.0),
01164     histMax(0.0),
01165     tagHandle(0),
01166     stoppingFunction(false),
01167     referenceCount(0)
01168 {
01169   reset_data();
01170 }
01171 
01172 const QualityAssessor::Assessor* QualityAssessor::get_results( QualityMetric* metric ) const
01173 {
01174   list_type::const_iterator iter;
01175   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01176     if ((*iter)->get_metric() == metric)
01177       return *iter;
01178   return 0;
01179 }
01180 
01181 const QualityAssessor::Assessor* QualityAssessor::get_results( const char* name ) const
01182 {
01183   list_type::const_iterator iter;
01184   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01185     if ((*iter)->get_label() == name)
01186       return *iter;
01187   return 0;
01188 }
01189 
01190 
01191 void QualityAssessor::Assessor:: get_histogram( double& lower_bound_out,
01192                                                 double& upper_bound_out,
01193                                                 std::vector<int>& counts_out,
01194                                                 MsqError& err ) const 
01195 {
01196   if ( !have_histogram() )
01197   {
01198     MSQ_SETERR(err)("No histogram calculated.", MsqError::INVALID_STATE);
01199     return;
01200   }
01201 
01202   lower_bound_out = histMin;
01203   upper_bound_out = histMax;
01204   counts_out = histogram;
01205 }
01206 
01207 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::reset_data()
01208 {
01209   count = 0;
01210   sum = 0;
01211   maximum = -HUGE_VAL;
01212   minimum = HUGE_VAL;
01213   sqrSum = 0;
01214   pSum = 0;
01215   numInvalid = 0;
01216     // zero histogram data
01217   size_t hist_size = histogram.size();
01218   histogram.clear();
01219   histogram.resize( hist_size, 0 );
01220 }
01221 
01222 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::add_value( double metric_value )
01223 {
01224   sum += metric_value;
01225   sqrSum += metric_value*metric_value;
01226   if (metric_value > maximum)
01227     maximum = metric_value;
01228   if (metric_value < minimum)
01229     minimum = metric_value;
01230     // Only add value to histogram data from this function if
01231     // the user has specified the range.  If user has not 
01232     // specified the range, QualityAssessor will call add_hist_value()
01233     // directly once the range has been calculated.
01234   if (have_histogram() && haveHistRange)
01235     add_hist_value( metric_value );
01236   
01237   if (have_power_mean())
01238     pSum += pow( metric_value, pMean );
01239   
01240   ++count;
01241 }
01242 
01243 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::add_invalid_value()
01244 {
01245   ++numInvalid;
01246 }
01247 
01248 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::add_hist_value( double metric_value )
01249 {
01250     // First and last values in array are counts of values
01251     // outside the user-specified range of the histogram
01252     // (below and above, respectively.)
01253   if (metric_value < histMin)
01254     ++histogram[0];
01255   else if (metric_value > histMax)
01256     ++histogram[histogram.size()-1];
01257   else
01258   {
01259       // Calculate which interval the value is in.  Add one
01260       // because first entry is for values below user-specifed
01261       // minimum value for histogram.
01262     double range = histMax - histMin;
01263     double fract;
01264     if (range > DBL_EPSILON)
01265       fract = (metric_value - histMin) / range;
01266     else
01267       fract = 0.0;
01268     unsigned cell;
01269     if (fabs(fract - 1.0) < histMax*DBL_EPSILON)
01270       cell = histogram.size() - 1;
01271     else
01272       cell = 1 + (int)((fract * (histogram.size()-2)));
01273 
01274       // Add value to interval.
01275     ++histogram[cell];
01276   }
01277 }
01278 
01279 
01280 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::calculate_histogram_range()
01281 {
01282   double step = (maximum - minimum) / (histogram.size() - 2);
01283   if (step == 0)
01284     step = 1.0;
01285   double size = pow( 10.0, ceil(log10(step)) );
01286   if (size < 1e-6) 
01287     size = 1.0;
01288   histMin = size * floor( minimum / size );
01289   histMax = size *  ceil( maximum / size );
01290 }  
01291 
01292 void QualityAssessor::print_summary( std::ostream& stream ) const
01293 {
01294   const int NAMEW = 19;  // Width of name column in table output
01295   const int NUMW = 12;   // Width of value columns in table output
01296   
01297     // Print title
01298   stream << std::endl 
01299          << "************** " 
01300          << qualityAssessorName
01301          << " Summary **************"
01302          << std::endl
01303          << std::endl;
01304          
01305   if (myData->freeElementCount != myData->elementCount)
01306     stream << "  Evaluating quality for " << myData->freeElementCount 
01307            << " free elements of " << myData->elementCount 
01308            << " total elements." << std::endl;
01309   else
01310     stream << "  Evaluating quality for " << myData->elementCount 
01311            << " elements." << std::endl;
01312 
01313     // Print element type totals
01314   std::string str_value = "";
01315   for (int i=POLYGON; i <= MIXED; i++)
01316   {
01317     if ( elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON] )
01318     {
01319       str_value = element_name_as_string(i);
01320       if (str_value != "")
01321         stream << "  This mesh had " 
01322                << elementTypeCount[i - POLYGON]
01323                << " " << str_value << " elements." << std::endl;
01324     }
01325   }
01326   
01327   if (myData->invertedElementCount) {
01328     stream << "  THERE ARE "
01329            << myData->invertedElementCount
01330            << " INVERTED ELEMENTS. "
01331            << std::endl
01332            << "  (Elements invalid at "
01333            << myData->invertedSampleCount
01334            << " of " << myData->sampleCount
01335            << " sample locations.)"
01336            << std::endl
01337            << std::endl;
01338   }
01339   else {
01340     stream << "  There were no inverted elements detected. "
01341            << std::endl;
01342   }
01343   
01344     // Check if there are invalid values for any metric
01345   list_type::const_iterator iter;
01346   bool some_invalid = false;
01347   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
01348     if ((*iter)->get_invalid_element_count()) {
01349       some_invalid = true;
01350       stream << "  " << (*iter)->get_invalid_element_count()
01351              << " OF " << (*iter)->get_count()
01352              << " ENTITIES EVALUATED TO AN UNDEFINED VALUE FOR " 
01353              << (*iter)->get_label()
01354              << std::endl << std::endl;
01355     }
01356   }
01357   if (!some_invalid) {
01358     stream << "  No entities had undefined values for any computed metric." 
01359            << std::endl << std::endl;
01360   }
01361          
01362     // Check if a user-define power-mean was calculated for any of the metrics
01363   std::set<double> pmeans;
01364   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01365     if ((*iter)->have_power_mean())
01366       pmeans.insert( (*iter)->get_power() );
01367       
01368     // If power-mean of 1 or 2 was requested, change titles rather
01369     // than printing redundant values
01370   std::string average_str("average"), rms_str("rms");
01371   if (pmeans.find(1.0) != pmeans.end()) {
01372     pmeans.erase( pmeans.find(1.0) );
01373     average_str = "1-mean";
01374   }
01375   if (pmeans.find(2.0) != pmeans.end()) {
01376     pmeans.erase( pmeans.find(2.0) );
01377     rms_str = "2-mean";
01378   }
01379   
01380     // Number of values in table
01381   unsigned num_values = pmeans.size() + 5;
01382   
01383     // Decide how wide of a table field shoudl be used for the metric name
01384   unsigned twidth = get_terminal_width();
01385   unsigned maxnwidth = NAMEW;
01386   if (twidth) {
01387     unsigned valwidth = NUMW*num_values;
01388     maxnwidth = valwidth < twidth ? twidth - valwidth : 0;
01389   }
01390   unsigned namewidth = 0;
01391   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01392     if ((*iter)->get_label().size() > namewidth)
01393       namewidth = (*iter)->get_label().size();
01394   if (namewidth > maxnwidth)
01395     namewidth = maxnwidth;
01396   if (namewidth < 7)  // at least enough width for the column header
01397     namewidth = 7;
01398     
01399     // print comlumn label line
01400   std::set<double>::const_iterator piter;
01401   stream << std::setw(namewidth) << "metric";
01402   stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << "minimum";
01403   for (piter = pmeans.begin(); piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 1.0; ++piter)
01404     stream << std::setw(NUMW-6) << *piter << "-mean ";
01405   stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << average_str;
01406   for (; piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 2.0; ++piter)
01407     stream << std::setw(NUMW-6) << *piter << "-mean ";
01408   stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << rms_str;
01409   for (; piter != pmeans.end(); ++piter)
01410     stream << std::setw(NUMW-6) << *piter << "-mean ";
01411   stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << "maximum";
01412   stream << std::setw(NUMW)      << "std.dev.";
01413   stream << std::endl;
01414   
01415     // print metric values
01416   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter) {
01417       // print name
01418     stream << std::setw(namewidth) << (*iter)->get_label();
01419     if ((*iter)->get_label().size() > namewidth) 
01420       stream << std::endl << std::setw(namewidth) << " ";
01421       // print minimum
01422     stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_minimum();
01423       // print power-means with P less than 1.0
01424     for (piter = pmeans.begin(); piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 1.0; ++piter) {
01425       if ((*iter)->have_power_mean() && (*iter)->get_power() == *piter) 
01426         stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_power_mean();
01427       else
01428         stream << std::setw(NUMW) << " ";
01429     }
01430       // print average
01431     stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_average();
01432       // print power-means with P less than 2.0
01433     for ( ; piter != pmeans.end() && *piter < 2.0; ++piter) {
01434       if ((*iter)->have_power_mean() && (*iter)->get_power() == *piter) 
01435         stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_power_mean();
01436       else
01437         stream << std::setw(NUMW) << " ";
01438     }
01439       // print RMS
01440     stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_rms();
01441       // print power-means with P greater than 2.0
01442     for ( ; piter != pmeans.end(); ++piter) {
01443       if ((*iter)->have_power_mean() && (*iter)->get_power() == *piter) 
01444         stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_power_mean();
01445       else
01446         stream << std::setw(NUMW) << " ";
01447     }
01448       // print maximum and standard deviation
01449     stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_maximum();
01450     stream << std::setw(NUMW) << (*iter)->get_stddev();
01451     stream << std::endl;
01452   }
01453   
01454   for (iter = assessList.begin(); iter != assessList.end(); ++iter)
01455     if ((*iter)->have_histogram())
01456       (*iter)->print_histogram( stream, get_terminal_width() );
01457 }
01458 
01459 
01460 void QualityAssessor::Assessor::print_histogram( std::ostream& stream,
01461                                                  int termwidth ) const
01462 {
01463   // Portability notes:
01464   //  Use log10 rather than log10f because the float variations require
01465   //  including platform-dependent headers on some platforms.  
01466   //  Explicitly cast log10 argument to double because some platforms
01467   //  have overloaded float and double variations in C++ making an 
01468   //  implicit cast from an integer ambiguous.
01469   
01470   const char indent[] = "   ";
01471   const char GRAPH_CHAR = '=';  // Character used to create bar graphs
01472   const int TOTAL_WIDTH = termwidth > 30 ? termwidth : 70;   // Width of histogram
01473   int GRAPHW = TOTAL_WIDTH - sizeof(indent);
01474   
01475     // range is either user-specified (histMin & histMax) or
01476     // calculated (minimum & maximum)
01477   double min, max;
01478   min = histMin;
01479   max = histMax;
01480     // Witdh of one interval of histogram
01481   double step = (max - min) / (histogram.size()-2);
01482     // round step to 3 significant digits
01483   if (step >= 0.001)
01484     step = round_to_3_significant_digits(step);
01485   
01486     // Find maximum value for an interval bin of the histogram
01487   unsigned i;
01488   int max_bin_value = 1;
01489   for (i = 0; i < histogram.size(); ++i)
01490     if (histogram[i] > max_bin_value)
01491       max_bin_value = histogram[i];
01492   
01493   if (0 == max_bin_value)
01494     return; // no data 
01495   
01496     // Calculate width of field containing counts for 
01497     // histogram intervals (log10(max_bin_value)).
01498   int num_width = 1;
01499   for (int temp = max_bin_value; temp > 0; temp /= 10)
01500     ++num_width;
01501   GRAPHW -= num_width;
01502 
01503     // Create an array of bar graph characters for use in output
01504   std::vector<char> graph_chars(GRAPHW+1, GRAPH_CHAR);
01505   
01506     // Check if bar-graph should be linear or log10 plot
01507     // Do log plot if standard deviation is less that 1.5
01508     // histogram intervals.
01509   bool log_plot = false;
01510   double stddev = get_stddev();
01511   if (stddev > 0 && stddev < 2.0*step)
01512   {
01513     int new_interval = (int)(log10((double)(1+max_bin_value)));
01514     if (new_interval > 0) {
01515       log_plot = true;
01516       max_bin_value = new_interval;
01517     }
01518   }
01519   
01520     // Write title
01521   stream << std::endl << indent << get_label() << " histogram:";
01522   if (log_plot)
01523     stream << " (log10 plot)";
01524   stream << std::endl;
01525 
01526     // Calculate width of a single quality interval value
01527   double interval_value = 0.0;
01528   int max_interval_width = 0;
01529   std::stringstream str_stream;
01530   std::string interval_string; 
01531   for (i = 0; i < histogram.size(); ++i)
01532   {
01533     interval_value = min + (i)*step;
01534     if (step >= 0.001)
01535       interval_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(interval_value);
01536     str_stream.clear();
01537     str_stream.str(""); 
01538     interval_string = "";
01539     str_stream << interval_value;
01540     interval_string = str_stream.str();
01541     if (interval_string.length() >  (size_t)max_interval_width)
01542       max_interval_width = interval_string.length();
01543   }
01544 
01545     // adjust graph width for actual size of interval values
01546   GRAPHW = GRAPHW - (max_interval_width*2) - 5; 
01547 
01548     // For each interval of histogram
01549   for (i = 0; i < histogram.size(); ++i)
01550   {
01551       // First value is the count of the number of values that
01552       // were below the minimum value of the histogram.
01553     if (0 == i)
01554     {
01555       if (0 == histogram[i])
01556         continue;
01557       stream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "under min";
01558     }
01559       // Last value is the count of the number of values that
01560       // were above the maximum value of the histogram.
01561     else if (i+1 == histogram.size())
01562     {
01563       if (0 == histogram[i])
01564         continue;
01565       stream << indent << std::setw(max_interval_width) << "over max";
01566     }
01567       // Anything else is a valid interval of the histogram.
01568       // Print the range for each interval.
01569     else
01570     {
01571       double start_value = min + (i-1)*step;
01572       double end_value = min + (i)*step;
01573       if (step >= 0.001)
01574       {
01575         start_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(start_value);
01576         end_value = round_to_3_significant_digits(end_value);
01577       }
01578 
01579       stream << indent << "(" << std::setw(max_interval_width) << std::right 
01580              << start_value << "-" << std::setw(max_interval_width) 
01581              << std::left << end_value << ") |";
01582     }
01583 
01584       // Print bar graph
01585     
01586       // First calculate the number of characters to output
01587     int num_graph;
01588     if (log_plot)
01589       num_graph = GRAPHW * (int)log10((double)(1+histogram[i])) / max_bin_value;
01590     else
01591       num_graph = GRAPHW * histogram[i] / max_bin_value;
01592       
01593       // print num_graph characters using array of fill characters.
01594     graph_chars[num_graph] = '\0';
01595     stream << arrptr(graph_chars);
01596     graph_chars[num_graph] = GRAPH_CHAR;
01597 
01598       // Print interval count.
01599     stream << histogram[i] << std::endl;
01600     
01601   }
01602 
01603   stream << "  metric was evaluated " << count << " times." 
01604     << std::endl << std::endl;
01605 }
01606 
01607 #ifdef _MSC_VER
01608 # define fileno(A) _fileno( (A) )
01609 #endif 
01610 int QualityAssessor::get_terminal_width() const
01611 {
01612 #ifdef TIOCGWINSZ
01613   int fd = -1;
01614   if (&outputStream == &std::cout)
01615     fd = fileno(stdout);
01616   else if (&outputStream == &std::cerr)
01617     fd = fileno(stderr);
01618 #ifdef FSTREAM_HAS_FD
01619   else if (std::ofstream* f = dynamic_cast<std::ofstream*>(&outputStream))
01620     fd = f->rdbuf()->fd();
01621 #endif
01622 
01623   if (fd >= 0) {
01624     struct winsize ws;
01625     if (ioctl(fd, TIOCGWINSZ, &ws) >= 0)
01626       return ws.ws_col;
01627   }
01628 #endif
01629 
01630   return 0;
01631 }
01632 
01633 std::string QualityAssessor::element_name_as_string(int enum_name)
01634 {
01635   std::string str_value = "";
01636 
01637   switch (enum_name)
01638   {
01639     case POLYGON:       str_value.assign("polygon"); break;
01640     case TRIANGLE:      str_value.assign("triangle"); break;
01641     case QUADRILATERAL: str_value.assign("quadrilateral"); break;
01642     case POLYHEDRON:    str_value.assign("polyhedron"); break;
01643     case TETRAHEDRON:   str_value.assign("tetrahedron"); break;
01644     case HEXAHEDRON:    str_value.assign("hexahedron"); break;
01645     case PRISM:         str_value.assign("prism"); break;
01646     case SEPTAHEDRON:   str_value.assign("septahedron"); break;
01647     case MIXED:         str_value.assign("mixed"); break;
01648   }
01649 
01650   return str_value;
01651 }
01652 
01653 double QualityAssessor::round_to_3_significant_digits(double number)
01654 {
01655   double result = number;
01656   double p=1.0;
01657 
01658   if (number > 0 && number < 1000)
01659   {
01660     if ( number < 1000 )
01661     {
01662       while ( number <100 ) 
01663       {
01664         number *= 10;
01665         p *= 10;
01666       }
01667     }
01668     else 
01669     {
01670       while ( number >= 1000 )
01671       {
01672         number /= 10;
01673         p /= 10;
01674       }
01675     }
01676     int z = int(number + 0.5);
01677     result = z / p;
01678   }
01679 
01680   return result;
01681 }
01682 
01683 
01684 double QualityAssessor::Assessor::stopping_function_value() const
01685 {
01686   return have_power_mean() ? get_power_mean() : get_average();
01687 }
